name: Al-Arqam Islamic School
mission: TO MEET THE EDUCATIONAL NEEDS OF THE MUSLIM CHILDREN LIVING WITHIN THE GREATER SACRAMENTO AREA.
theoryOfChange: Al-Arqam Islamic School & College Preparatory has five Schoolwide Learning Outcomes (SLOs) conveyed through the acrostic TORCH. These SLOs are focused on establishing strong, cohesive, and engaging school programs designed to impact students academically, spiritually, socially, and physically. The revision process for these learner outcomes began in the Spring of the 2017-2018 academic year. The school's mission is to teach and nurture the 'whole' child—intellectually, spiritually, emotionally, and physically—and to instill principles of submission to the Will of Allah for personal and academic excellence. Their goals include teaching a love for Islam, practicing Islam daily, achieving first-rate academic standards, striving for excellence to compete effectively, and developing strong moral and spiritual character, self-worth, discipline, independence, ethical standards, love of learning, citizenship, and responsibility. The Islamic Education curriculum also aims for students to live Islam through submission to Allah, know Islam's history, use the Qur'an and Sunnah for decisions, take Prophet Muhammad (SAW) as a role model, and become lifelong learners by developing good study habits and being intellectual and well-rounded.
zakatClaimEvidence: The 'Donations' page of Al-Arqam Islamic School lists methods for general donations (checks, PayPal, Zelle) but does not explicitly mention 'zakat' or 'zakat-eligible' funds. (Source: https://www.charitynavigator.org/ein/943311132)

all_citations.claim: Al-Arqam Islamic School reports a program expense ratio of 98.1% and working capital of 9.1 months.
The organization recorded total revenue of $4,155,519 and a fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised.
The school serves the Greater Sacramento area with a focus on college preparatory academics.
The organization operates as Al-Arqam Islamic School & College Preparatory.
The school implements an International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program and a student honor code.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a 60/100 score due to its excellent internal financial management and program focus, though its overall rating is tempered by low data confidence and limited external verification.
areas_for_improvement: Limited data confidence and public transparency regarding long-term impact metrics
Low alignment with specific donor fit profiles despite high cause urgency in education

dimension_explanations.alignment: The alignment score of 24/50 reflects a high urgency for global education balanced against a low donor fit for general Muslim philanthropic profiles [1]. The institution operates as a sadaqah-eligible entity, focusing on academic and moral development through its honor code and IB curriculum [4][5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The school demonstrates high capacity-building impact by allocating 98.1% of its $4,155,519 revenue toward its core educational programs [1][2]. While it maintains a solid 9.1 months of working capital, the lack of third-party cost-per-beneficiary data results in a moderate impact score of 37/50 [1][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: Al-Arqam Islamic School provides comprehensive college preparatory and International Baccalaureate education to Muslim youth in the Greater Sacramento area.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 98.1%, ensuring nearly all funds directly support educational services
Strong financial stability with 9.1 months of working capital available
Highly efficient fundraising operations with a cost of $0.00 per $1 raised
baseline_narrative.summary: Al-Arqam Islamic School is a dedicated educational institution focused on meeting the academic needs of Muslim children through a rigorous college preparatory curriculum [1][3]. The school operates with a high degree of financial efficiency, reporting total revenue of $4,155,519 and maintaining an International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program [2][5].

However, credibility is currently limited by <cite id="15">low data verification scores</cite> and the absence of a Candid transparency seal.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the school should <cite id="16">publish consistent beneficiary counts</cite> and seek external evaluations of its educational outcomes.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value local Islamic institutional building and want to support high-standard, IB-accredited education for Muslim youth in California.
donor_motivations: Want to support the long-term sustainability of Islamic K-12 education
Value rigorous academic standards like the International Baccalaureate
Prefer supporting established organizations with a 25+ year track record
Prioritize high financial efficiency where 100% of funds reach the school
giving_considerations: Donations are sadaqah-eligible but not verified for zakat
Impact is focused on a specific geographic community (Sacramento)
Limited public data is available regarding specific graduation or college placement rates
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fulfill zakat obligations or those requiring rigorous, third-party impact evaluations.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects a clear curriculum framework (IB) but a lack of published, longitudinal outcome data.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The school creates impact by providing a dual-curriculum (Academic and Islamic) that prepares students for higher education while maintaining their religious identity.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence helps donors understand the actual success rate of students entering higher education.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a 3.1% growth rate and high program efficiency, the school has capacity to expand its facilities and student body.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Al-Arqam's <cite id="7">100% program ratio</cite> is significantly higher than the <cite id="9">peer median of 89.6%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focus on religious services and community education
similar_organizations.name: Al Jazari Institute

strengths.detail: The school directs <cite id="7">100.0% of its expenses toward programs</cite>, significantly exceeding the <cite id="9">peer program ratio median of 89.6%</cite>.
Al-Arqam is authorized to offer the <cite id="3">International Baccalaureate (IB) Diploma Program</cite>, a globally recognized standard for college readiness.
The institution maintains <cite id="8">9.1 months of operating reserves</cite> and has achieved a <cite id="10">3-year revenue CAGR of 3.1%</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: Al-Arqam's financial model is notably lean, characterized by <cite id="11">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, meaning the school incurs virtually no costs to generate its charitable contributions. This efficiency is paired with a <cite id="12">100% independent board of directors</cite>, which provides robust oversight of the school's <cite id="13">$2,633,655 in total assets</cite>. The school's curriculum is comprehensive, featuring a <cite id="14">Tarbiyyah program for Islamic Studies and Qur’an</cite> alongside high-level academics, ensuring a holistic environment for Muslim students.
rich_narrative.summary: Al-Arqam Islamic School is a specialized educational institution that has served the Greater Sacramento area since its <cite id="1">founding in 1998</cite>. The organization focuses on providing a <cite id="2">comprehensive college preparatory curriculum</cite> integrated with Islamic values, specifically designed to meet the academic and spiritual needs of Muslim youth. The school's academic rigor is anchored by its status as an <cite id="3">International Baccalaureate (IB) World School</cite>, offering the prestigious IB Diploma Program alongside <cite id="4">Advanced Placement (AP) and Honors courses</cite>. Financially, the institution operates with a high degree of efficiency, reporting <cite id="5">total revenue of $4,155,519</cite> in the 2023 tax year. A significant portion of this income is generated through <cite id="6">program service revenue totaling $3,925,159</cite>, which reflects a sustainable model primarily supported by tuition and educational services. The organization demonstrates exceptional fiscal discipline, maintaining a <cite id="7">program expense ratio of 98.1%</cite> according to recent filings, ensuring that nearly all resources are directed toward student instruction and school operations. Furthermore, the school exhibits strong financial resilience with <cite id="8">9.1 months of working capital</cite> in reserve, providing a stable foundation for long-term educational programming.
